titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the William J. Niederpruem papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by David Jacobs

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-05T10:47-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: The William J. Niederpruem papers document the career of an American military officer who served in the United States Army during both World War I and World War II, and who was part of the American occupation authority in Japan after the end of the Second World War. As a staff officer with the 32nd Division, American Expeditionary Forces, Niederpruem served in France and Germany during 1918-1919. His collection includes orders and reports relating to this period, as well as a number of photographs and postcards depicting battlefield scenes from World War I. Much of the collection consists of printed matter, including pamphlets published by the American military during both world wars and serial issues with articles relating to World War II. There are also copies of newspapers with coverage of the ouster of General Douglas MacArthur during the Korean War.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William J. Niederpruem papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1966.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Statement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into 6 series: Military career file; Declassified U.S. government publications; Photographs; Postcards; Printed matter; and Oversize materials

chronitem.event: Official with U.S. occupation authority in Japan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The William J. Niederpruem papers document the career of an American military officer who served in the United States Army during both World War I and World War II, and who was part of the American occupation authority in Japan after the end of the Second World War. As a staff officer with the 32nd Division, American Expeditionary Forces, Niederpruem served in France and Germany during 1918-1919. His collection includes orders and reports relating to this period, as well as a number of photographs and postcards depicting battlefield scenes from World War I. Much of the collection consists of printed matter, including pamphlets published by the American military during both world wars and serial issues with articles relating to World War II. There are also copies of newspapers with coverage of the ouster of General Douglas MacArthur during the Korean War.

The Military career file contains orders, reports, and intelligence summaries, as well as a translation done by Niederpruem of a study of World War I strategy by William Groener. The collection contains numerous maps pertaining to the Western Front during World War I and the Philippines during World War II. There are also a number of regional maps of Japan in the papers.

controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. American Expeditionary Forces.
controlaccess.subject: Military government.
World War, 1914-1918--Campaigns--France.
World War, 1939-1945--United States.

did.unittitle: Intelligence summaries prepared for the Army Air Forces,
Leaflets produced by Psychological Warfare Branch, U.S. Army Forces, Pacific Area,
Orders issued by General John J. Pershing,
Reports relating to the 32d Division, American Expeditionary Forces,
Translation by William J. Niederpruem of text by Wilhem Groener, "A Field Marshall against His Will - Strategical Studies Based Upon World War I",
8 prints depicting aerial views of World War I battlefields,
1 print depicting American prisoners of war under German escort,
16 prints depicting American soldiers in France,
1 print depicting German soldiers in a trench,
8 prints depicting scenes of wartime devastation in France,
1 portfolio of 26 photographic reproductions depicting General Douglas MacArthur, American forces, and surrendering Japanese troops in the Philippines,
1 portfolio of 34 photographic reproductions depicting General Douglas MacArthur and scenes in Japan and Korea.,
24 cards depicting German and French soldiers,
11 cards depicting wartime devastation in France and Germany,
7 cards depicting tanks, artillery pieces, and a barrage balloon,
17 cards with illustrations depicting scenes of military and civilian life,
Calendar published for the German military,
Clippings relating to the Munich Crisis and World War II,
Japan: Its People, Its History, Its Land, Its Work,
Grauer, Alvin, So I Went to Japan,
March of the 32nd Division (American Expeditionary Forces) from the Meuse to the Rhine,
Pamphlet with chart, Truth and Facts of the World War,
Proclamations issued by the German Army in occupied Belgium and France,
Various newspapers with articles relating to General Douglas MacArthur,
